basedOn.display: CT Soft Tissue Neck W/Contrast Complex

valueString:
IMPRESSION: 
MRI brain 7/6/2009 and 9/22/2011: Lobulated scalp lesion within the left 
occiput, as well as a smaller lobulated lesion within the left retromolar 
trigone, which demonstrate no significant change between these 2 studies 
compatible with nerve sheath tumors.
CT neck 7/7/2011: Multiple well-circumscribed soft tissue lesions 
compatible with schwannomas, the largest extending from the left C3-C4 
neural foramen.
MRI cervical, thoracic, and lumbar spine 9/22/2011: Multilevel soft 
tissue lesions compatible with nerve sheath tumors, the majority 
extending from expanded cervical neuroforamina, the largest extending 
from the left C3-C4 neural foramen. Multiple intercostal nerve sheath 
tumors seen within the thoracic spine. No definite lesions seen within 
the lumbar spine.




Please note that the images provided for interpretation are not of the 
quality typically generated at Johns Hopkins, potentially due to 
technical issues or image transfer quality. Therefore the strength of any 
conclusions based on the interpretation of these non-optimal images must 
be qualified.Repeat examination at Johns Hopkins Hospital should be 
considered for patient care.


..: Created By HSA1  . Last update: Nov 25 2013 10:18A.
